definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Put the hyphen character at the start or the end of the bracketed list.
sentences.chinese: 将连字符放在中括号列表的开始或结尾。

sentences.english: A Mandarin pronunciation is provided in the brackets behind each dish.
sentences.chinese: 下面的菜名中括号部分是该菜肴的中文拼音。

sentences.english: Note that we are using the square brackets to mark the cursor position.
sentences.chinese: 注意一下，我们用中括号来标记目前的游标位置。

sentences.english: Mandarin 7 pronunciation is provided in the brackets behind each dish.
sentences.chinese: 下面的菜名中括号部分是该菜肴的中文拼音。

sentences.english: Parenthetical text indicates the parameter name.
sentences.chinese: 中括号中的文字表示参数名称。

sentences.english: No extra white spaces, square brackets are well-formed, etc.
sentences.chinese: 没有额外的空白字符，中括号也是格式良好的，等等。

sentences.english: Within brackets, as anywhere else, ordinary characters represent themselves.
sentences.chinese: 与在其他位置一样，普通字符在中括号中表示其本身。

sentences.english: You also use the brackets when you refer to the name later in your code.
sentences.chinese: 以后在代码中引用该名称时同样使用中括号。

definition: blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
